bug.short_desc: sieve's yacc stack depth is too shallow

long_desc.thetext:
It looks like pre-generated version of sieve.c in sieve directory has changed from bison to byacc sometime while ago.
The generated version of the parser do not accept a rule with "yacc stack overflow." This is because byacc's default depth is 500, which is shallow, and some scripts (like mine) which use deep stack (more than 1000) will not be accepted by the sieve engine with this pre-genarated source.
I have worked around this by just removing sieve.c and generate sieve.c from byacc on FreeBSD, which has defaulted YYMAXDEPTH to 10000. Note that stock byacc's default is 500. I have no idea good value of this in general, but for my case, I need at least 2000.
# I know, my rule is strange.. but part of it is generated by program, I prefer to recompile it.
hope this help.
This is fixed in git and will be in the next version. I have set an explicit value of 10000 as bison provides.
